intro: Tragia velutina, commonly known as velvet tragia, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, velvety stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, yellow flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Tragia velutina is typically found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
